intro: Vernonia chiriquiensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as savannas and grasslands. It produces small, yellow to brown flowers that are clustered in dense spherical heads. Vernonia chiriquiensis is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
